snippet: Cheri Young, whose husband was a longtime aide to John Edwards, traded jabs with a defense lawyer during cross-examination on Tuesday.
abstract: Cheri Young, whose husband Andrew was a longtime aide to John Edwards, trades jabs with defense lawyer during cross-examination in Edwards's federal corruption trial; Edwards is alleged to have used illegal campaign contributions to conceal an affair. Photo (M)

byline.original: By LIZETTE ALVAREZ; William Dupre contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: GREENSBORO, N.C. -- Facing cross-examination in the federal corruption trial of John Edwards, Cheri Young, the wife of a former Edwards aide, proved to be an infuriating witness on Tuesday as she swatted back questions and skewered insinuations. In the daylong exchange with Alan Duncan, one of Mr. Edwards's lawyers, Ms. Young showed she could be as recalcitrant and incisive on Tuesday as she was forthright and emotional on Monday, when she was called as a prosecution witness.

headline.main: Edwards Defense Team Makes Few Inroads With Ex-Aide's Wife on Witness Stand
